channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Thousands in Philippines protest corruption, demand return of stolen funds
item.description: Thousands of demonstrators including from the dominant Roman Catholic church clergy are protesting in the Philippines, calling for the swift prosecution of top legislators.
item.content:encoded:
Thousands of demonstrators including from the dominant Roman Catholic church clergy are protesting in the Philippines, calling for the swift prosecution of top legislators.

(Image credit: Aaron Favila)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Lost for over 400 years, Rubens painting sells for $2.7 million at auction
item.description: An auctioneer stumbled upon the long lost painting, which depicts the crucifixion of Jesus Christ, inside a Paris townhouse last year during a routine visit.
item.content:encoded:
An auctioneer stumbled upon the long lost painting, which depicts the crucifixion of Jesus Christ, inside a Paris townhouse last year during a routine visit.

(Image credit: Michel Euler)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: Michael Jordan's fight against NASCAR heads to court
item.description: Michael Jordan's 23XI Racing and Front Row Motorsports are taking NASCAR to federal court Monday over antitrust allegations.
item.content:encoded:
Michael Jordan's 23XI Racing and Front Row Motorsports are taking NASCAR to federal court Monday over antitrust allegations.

(Image credit: Butch Dill)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Venezuela calls Trump's call to close airspace a 'colonialist threat'
item.description: President Trump said that the airspace "above and surrounding Venezuela" was "closed in its entirety". In response, the Venezuelan government said his comments violate international law, and are a "colonialist threat" to its sovereignty.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump said that the airspace "above and surrounding Venezuela" was "closed in its entirety". In response, the Venezuelan government said his comments violate international law, and are a "colonialist threat" to its sovereignty.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Lydia Calitri

item.title: More cities are seeing PFAS pollution in drinking water. Here's what Louisville found
item.description: Workers at the drinking water plant in Louisville, Ky. saw a sudden spike in the level of a 'forever chemical.' They traced it up the Ohio River to a factory embroiled in a pollution lawsuit.
item.content:encoded:
Workers at the drinking water plant in Louisville, Ky. saw a sudden spike in the level of a 'forever chemical.' They traced it up the Ohio River to a factory embroiled in a pollution lawsuit. 

(Image credit: Visions of America/Joseph Sohm)
item.dc:creator: Morgan Watkins

item.title: During the war in Gaza, Israel drastically changed the map of the West Bank
item.description: During the Gaza war, Israel raced to redistrict land in the occupied West Bank, drastically changing the map. Palestinians say annexation is underway, though Israel denies it.
item.content:encoded: During the Gaza war, Israel raced to redistrict land in the occupied West Bank, drastically changing the map. Palestinians say annexation is underway, though Israel denies it.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: Netanyahu submits request for a pardon during his ongoing corruption trial
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has asked Israel's president to grant him a pardon during his long-running corruption trial that's bitterly divided the country.
item.content:encoded:
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has asked Israel's president to grant him a pardon during his long-running corruption trial that's bitterly divided the country.

(Image credit: Ohad Zwigenberg)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Rubio says US-Ukraine talks on Russia war were productive but much work remains in search of a deal
item.description: U.S. and Ukrainian officials completed roughly four hours of talks aimed at finding an endgame to the war between Russia and Ukraine.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. and Ukrainian officials completed roughly four hours of talks aimed at finding an endgame to the war between Russia and Ukraine.

(Image credit: Terry Renna)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: SNAP was restored, but many indigenous Americans still struggle with food insecurity
item.description: During the government shutdown, disruptions in food aid rippled across reservations. Both residents and tribal officials had to make tough choices, and are still feeling the financial impacts.
item.content:encoded:
During the government shutdown, disruptions in food aid rippled across reservations. Both residents and tribal officials had to make tough choices, and are still feeling the financial impacts.

(Image credit: MPSharwood)
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bolton

item.title: AI video slop is everywhere, take our quiz to try and spot it
item.description: There's no one way to be absolutely sure about a video's authenticity, but experts say there are some simple clues that can help.
item.content:encoded:
There's no one way to be absolutely sure about a video's authenticity, but experts say there are some simple clues that can help.

(Image credit: Screenshots by NPR)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel
